statement.p: Guido is flying west at 6500 MSL using the local altimeter setting of 27.64 inHg. In the lower atmosphere the pressure drops approximately 1 inHg per 1000 feet of elevation gained.
How much does the pressure drop from the ground (0 MSL) to 6500 ft above? inHg
If the pressure is 27.64 inHg at 0 MSL, what is the pressure at 6500 ft MSL? inHg

solution.p: Because this is a drop in pressure, the expected pressure is \displaystyle{P}={27.64}\ \text{ inHg}-{6.5}\ \text{ inHg}={21.14}\ \text{ inHg}.
